<ce:section-title id="sectitle0010">Abstract</ce:section-title><ce:simple-para id="abspara0010" view="all">Three cadmium(II) coordination polymesrs (CP) based on 2,2′-bipyridine-N,N′-dioxide (bipy-O2) as a coligand bridged by azido, thiocyanato and dicyanamido anions were synthesized. The complexes <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,1</ce:inf>-N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>), <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,3</ce:inf>-NCS)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>) and <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-dca)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>), where dca = dicyanamide anion, NCNCN<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> were structurally characterized by X-ray single crystallography. The complexes display six-coordinated geometry around the central Cd(II) ion through the two oxygen atoms of the seven-membered chelating bipy-O2 molecule in <ce:italic>cis</ce:italic> conformation and four <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>-donor atoms of the doubly bridged end-on N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>
<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> in complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and in the dicyanamido complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> as well as the doubly bridged end-to-end through the terminal two <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>
<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph> and two <ce:italic>S</ce:italic>-donors in the corresponding thiocyanato compound <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>. These arrangements led to the generation of 1D CP in the azido and thiocyanato complexes and a 2D CP in the dicyanamido complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold>. The luminescence and thermoanalytical properties of the complexes were also investigated.</ce:simple-para>
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

Three cadmium(II) coordination polymesrs (CP) based on 2,2'-bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide (bipy-O2) as a coligand bridged by azido, thiocyanato and dicyanamido anions were synthesized. The complexes catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,1-N3)2] (1), catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,3-NCS)2] (2) and catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,5-dca)2] (3), where dca=dicyanamide anion, NCNCN- were structurally characterized by X-ray single crystallography. The complexes display six-coordinated geometry around the central Cd(II) ion through the two oxygen atoms of the seven-membered chelating bipy-O2 molecule in cis conformation and four N-donor atoms of the doubly bridged end-on N3 - in complex 1 and in the dicyanamido complex 3 as well as the doubly bridged end-to-end through the terminal two N  and two S-donors in the corresponding thiocyanato compound 2. These arrangements led to the generation of 1D CP in the azido and thiocyanato complexes and a 2D CP in the dicyanamido complex 3. The luminescence and thermoanalytical properties of the complexes were also investigated.

Three coordination polymers 1D catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,1-N3)2] (1), 1D catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,3-NCS)2] (2) and 2D catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,5-dca)2] (3) bridged by pseudohalides were synthesized and their crystal structure were determined by single crystal X-ray crystallography.  Image 1

Highlights

   ⋅ 2,2'-Bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide (bipy-O2).   ⋅ 1D catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,1-N3)2].   ⋅ 1D catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,3-NCS)2].   ⋅ 2D catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,5-dca)2] (dca=dicyanamide anion).   

2,2'-Bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide (bipy-O2).

1D catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,1-N3)2].

1D catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,3-NCS)2].

2D catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,5-dca)2] (dca=dicyanamide anion).

Introduction

Small pseudohalide ions N3 -, NCS- and NCO- as well as long pseudohalide such as dicyananido, N(CN)2 - are versatile ligands that can bind divalent metal ions (Mn2+, Co2+, Ni2+, Cu2+, Zn2+ and Cd2+) in a variety of ways where the metal ions are assembled through the bridging-pseudohalide leading to the construction of coordination polymers with different nuclearity and dimensionality []. The bridging small pseudohalides, especially azide ion, are good mediators for magnetic exchange interaction between paramagnetic metal centers []. These ions have the ability to assemble metal ions in various coordination modes resulting in the formation of different framework and topologies []. In bridging-azido [], -thiocyanato [], -cyanato [] and -dicyanamido [] metal complexes different bridging bonding modes ranging from terminal end-to-end, EE-doubly bridged (μ1,x, x=3 in small pseudohalides and x=5 in dicyanamido) and end-on, EO-doubly bridging in small pseudohalides (μx,x with x=1 or 3). Other less common multi bonding pseudohalide bridging coordination modes have also been known and structurally characterized . The bonding modes have been summarized and recently reported for the azido , thiocyanato [], cyanato  and dicyanamido [] complexes.

elements.clean_text: Three different bonding modes have been recognized when a di-/tri-valent metal ion (M) interacts with 2,2'-bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide ligand (bipy-O2) through its oxide groups: 1) bidentate ligand forming seven-membered chelate ring size (I) which represents the most common bonding mode for the ligand [], 2) monodentate ligand, where the pyridyl-N-oxide groups are located trans to each other via rotation around the single bond (II) [] and 3) bridging ligand as μ2,2,2'-bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide (III) [] ( ). In general, the interaction of  (n-1)  d  10  (n=4 or 5) metal ions Zn(II) and Cd(II) with nitrogen heterocyclic coligands may enhance or quench the fluorescence emission of the organic ligand [,,].

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0040" view="all">Herein, we synthesized a new series of coordination polymers of azido, thiocyanato and dicyanamido Cd(II) complexes using 2,2′-bipyridine-N,N′-dioxide as a coligand (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>). This will allow us to evaluate the role played by the pseudohalide in directing the degree of dimensionality in these complexes.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: Herein, we synthesized a new series of coordination polymers of azido, thiocyanato and dicyanamido Cd(II) complexes using 2,2'-bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide as a coligand (1-3). This will allow us to evaluate the role played by the pseudohalide in directing the degree of dimensionality in these complexes.

elements.content: <ce:section-title id="sectitle0035">Experimental</ce:section-title><ce:section-title id="sectitle0040">Materials and physical measurements</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0045" view="all">2,2′-Bipyridine-N,N′-dioxide was purchased from TCI-America and all other chemicals were of analytical grade quality. Infrared spectra were recorded on a Cary 630 (ATR) spectrometer. Elemental microanalyses were carried out by Atlantic Microlaboratory, Norcross, Georgia U.S.A. Bulk phase purity of the three complexes was examined with a Bruker D8 Advance X-ray powder diffractometer (Cu-Kα radiation) and the corresponding observed and simulated X-Ray powder patterns are depicted in . A NETSCH STA 409 was used for thermoanalysis (heating rate: 10 °C/min, inert gas flow: 40 mL N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>/min). Emission spectra were recorded with a Perkin-Elmer LS55 spectrofluorometer.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Experimental

Materials and physical measurements

2,2'-Bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide was purchased from TCI-America and all other chemicals were of analytical grade quality. Infrared spectra were recorded on a Cary 630 (ATR) spectrometer. Elemental microanalyses were carried out by Atlantic Microlaboratory, Norcross, Georgia U.S.A. Bulk phase purity of the three complexes was examined with a Bruker D8 Advance X-ray powder diffractometer (Cu-Kα radiation) and the corresponding observed and simulated X-Ray powder patterns are depicted in . A NETSCH STA 409 was used for thermoanalysis (heating rate: 10°C/min, inert gas flow: 40mL N2/min). Emission spectra were recorded with a Perkin-Elmer LS55 spectrofluorometer.

elements.clean_text:
Synthesis of the complexes

 Caution! Salts of azide and their metal complexes are potentially explosive and should be handled with great care and in small quantities.

Synthesis of catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,3-N3)2] (1)

To mixture containing Cd(NO3)2⋅4H2O (0.154g, 0.50mmol) and bipyrdine-N,N'-dioxide (0.095g, 0.50mmol) dissolved in MeOH (20mL), an aqueous solution of NaN3 (0.065g, 1.00mmol in 5mLH2O) was added. The resulting solution was heated for 5min on a steam-bath, filtered through celite and then allowed to crystallize at room temperature. In the following day, the white long needles which separated were collected by filtration, washed with propan-2-ol and Et2O, and dried in the air (yield: 0.130g, 68%). Characterization: Anal. Calc. for C10H8CdN8O2 (384.63g/mol): C, 31.23; H, 2.10; N, 29.13. Found: C, 31.04; H, 2.07; N, 29.06%. Selected IR bands (ATR-IR, cm-1): 3082 (w), 2050 (s), 2029 (s), 1488 (m), 1425 (m), 1336 (m), 1285 (m), 1200 (s), 846 (m), 829 (s), 765 (vs).

elements.content:
<ce:section-title id="sectitle0065">Single –crystal X-ray analysis</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0070" view="all">The single-crystal X-ray data of compounds <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>3</ce:bold> were collected on a Bruker-AXS APEX CCD diffractometer at 100(2) K. The crystallographic data, conditions for the intensity data collection and some features of the structure refinements are listed in 
<ce:float-anchor refid="tbl1"></ce:float-anchor>. The intensities were collected with Mo-Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å). Data processing, Lorentz-polarisation and absorption corrections were performed using APEX and SADABS programs []. The structures were solved by direct methods and all non-hydrogen atoms were refined using full-matrix least-squares procedure on F<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>, using the SHELXL program []. The hydrogen atoms were located from difference Fourier maps, assigned with isotropic displacement factors and included in the final refinement cycles by use of the HFIX (parent C atom) instructions. Molecular plots were performed using Mercury program []. In case of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>, structure refinement is affected by the two-fold disorder of bipy-O2 ligand molecules (unusual Uij values of some C atoms with partial occupancy) and low crystal quality (high residual extrema in close vicinity of the cadmium metal centers).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Single -crystal X-ray analysis

The single-crystal X-ray data of compounds 1-3 were collected on a Bruker-AXS APEX CCD diffractometer at 100(2) K. The crystallographic data, conditions for the intensity data collection and some features of the structure refinements are listed in  . The intensities were collected with Mo-Kα radiation (λ=0.71073Å). Data processing, Lorentz-polarisation and absorption corrections were performed using APEX and SADABS programs []. The structures were solved by direct methods and all non-hydrogen atoms were refined using full-matrix least-squares procedure on F2, using the SHELXL program []. The hydrogen atoms were located from difference Fourier maps, assigned with isotropic displacement factors and included in the final refinement cycles by use of the HFIX (parent C atom) instructions. Molecular plots were performed using Mercury program []. In case of 1, structure refinement is affected by the two-fold disorder of bipy-O2 ligand molecules (unusual Uij values of some C atoms with partial occupancy) and low crystal quality (high residual extrema in close vicinity of the cadmium metal centers).

elements.content: <ce:section-title id="sectitle0070">Results and discussion</ce:section-title><ce:section-title id="sectitle0075">Synthesis and IR spectra of the complexes</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0075" view="all">The synthesis of the complexes <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,1</ce:inf>-N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>), <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,3</ce:inf>-NCS)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>) and <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-dca)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>) was straight forward. Reaction of a methanolic solution containing equimolar amounts of Cd(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O and bipyrdine-N,N'-dioxide in presence of two equivalents of NaN<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>, NH<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>NCS or Nadca, dissolved in aqueous solution, afforded the desired compounds in reasonable yields (52–92%). White tiny single crystals of X-ray quality were obtained from dilute solutions.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Results and discussion

Synthesis and IR spectra of the complexes

The synthesis of the complexes catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,1-N3)2] (1), catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,3-NCS)2] (2) and catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,5-dca)2] (3) was straight forward. Reaction of a methanolic solution containing equimolar amounts of Cd(NO3)2⋅4H2O and bipyrdine-N,N'-dioxide in presence of two equivalents of NaN3, NH4NCS or Nadca, dissolved in aqueous solution, afforded the desired compounds in reasonable yields (52-92%). White tiny single crystals of X-ray quality were obtained from dilute solutions.

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0080" view="all">The IR spectra of the complexes <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>3</ce:bold> display the general characteristic features for the coordinated bipy-O2 coligand expected for the pseudohalides. The strong absorption band observed at 2100 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> is due to the asymmetric stretching frequency ν<ce:inf loc="post">as</ce:inf>(CN) of the coordinated thiocyanato ligands in complex <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>. The two strong bands at located at 2050 and 2029 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> can be attributed to ν<ce:inf loc="post">as</ce:inf>(N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>) of the bridged azido groups in <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>. The medium to strong intensity bands detected over the vibrational region 2300-2145 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> in complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> are typical for the asymmetric stretching frequency ν<ce:inf loc="post">as</ce:inf>(CN) in dicyanamido complexes [,,]. The split of the low energy band into 2168, 2162 and 2145 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> is most likely attributed to the presence of the bonded terminal <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>-atoms of dca in two different coordination environment (see X-Ray 3.2.3 section and ).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: The IR spectra of the complexes 1-3 display the general characteristic features for the coordinated bipy-O2 coligand expected for the pseudohalides. The strong absorption band observed at 2100cm-1 is due to the asymmetric stretching frequency νas(CN) of the coordinated thiocyanato ligands in complex 2. The two strong bands at located at 2050 and 2029cm-1 can be attributed to νas(N3) of the bridged azido groups in 1. The medium to strong intensity bands detected over the vibrational region 2300-2145cm-1 in complex 3 are typical for the asymmetric stretching frequency νas(CN) in dicyanamido complexes [,,]. The split of the low energy band into 2168, 2162 and 2145cm-1 is most likely attributed to the presence of the bonded terminal N-atoms of dca in two different coordination environment (see X-Ray 3.2.3 section and ).

elements.content:
<ce:section-title id="sectitle0080">Description of the crystal structures</ce:section-title><ce:section-title id="sectitle0085">Catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,1</ce:inf>-N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0085" view="all">A perspective view of a section of the polymeric chain of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> is given in 
<ce:float-anchor refid="fig1"></ce:float-anchor>, a packing view in  and selected bond parameters are summarized in 
<ce:float-anchor refid="tbl2"></ce:float-anchor>. Each of the two crystallographic independent Cd(II) metal centers are <ce:italic>six-</ce:italic>coordinated by four <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>-donors of azido anions which act as bis-μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,1</ce:inf>-bridging ligands to generate polymeric chains of polyhedra along the <ce:italic>c</ce:italic>-axis of the triclinic unit cell, whereas the remaining two sites are occupied by two <ce:italic>cis</ce:italic>-coordinated oxygen donor atoms of the chelating bipy-O2 molecule. The atoms of complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> show a two-fold disorder with approx. 2:1 occupancy ratio of their two split orientations. Within the distorted CdN<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> octahedra the Cd<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>N bond distances are in the range from 2.263(11) to 2.381(11) Å, and the Cd<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>O bond distances vary from 2.212(4) to 2.439(4) Å, respectively. The bis-μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,1</ce:inf>-azide bridges have the following bond parameters: Cd<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>N<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>Cd from 100.2(4) to 107.8(4)°, N<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>Cd<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>N from 72.2(4) to 85.2(4)°, Cd<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>N<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>N from 119.2(8) to 128.1(10)°, N<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>N<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>N from 177.5(14) to 178.8(14)°. The intra-chain Cd⋯Cd distances are 3.670, 3.588 and 3.715 Å, whereas the shortest inter-chain metal-metal separation is 8.827 Å. The azide groups are asymmetric with longer Nα-Nβ bond distances from 1.198(14) to 1.228(14) Å, and shorter Nβ-Nγ bond distances from 1.148(15) to 1.167(14) Å, respectively (Nα is the bridging atom within the azide group). The mean planes of the two pyridyl rings within the disordered bipy-O2 molecules are inclined by approx. 65°.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Description of the crystal structures

Catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,1-N3)2] (1)

A perspective view of a section of the polymeric chain of 1 is given in  , a packing view in  and selected bond parameters are summarized in  . Each of the two crystallographic independent Cd(II) metal centers are six-coordinated by four N-donors of azido anions which act as bis-μ1,1-bridging ligands to generate polymeric chains of polyhedra along the c-axis of the triclinic unit cell, whereas the remaining two sites are occupied by two cis-coordinated oxygen donor atoms of the chelating bipy-O2 molecule. The atoms of complex 1 show a two-fold disorder with approx. 2:1 occupancy ratio of their two split orientations. Within the distorted CdN4O2 octahedra the CdN bond distances are in the range from 2.263(11) to 2.381(11) Å, and the CdO bond distances vary from 2.212(4) to 2.439(4) Å, respectively. The bis-μ1,1-azide bridges have the following bond parameters: CdNCd from 100.2(4) to 107.8(4)°, NCdN from 72.2(4) to 85.2(4)°, CdNN from 119.2(8) to 128.1(10)°, NNN from 177.5(14) to 178.8(14)°. The intra-chain Cd⋯Cd distances are 3.670, 3.588 and 3.715Å, whereas the shortest inter-chain metal-metal separation is 8.827Å. The azide groups are asymmetric with longer Nα-Nβ bond distances from 1.198(14) to 1.228(14) Å, and shorter Nβ-Nγ bond distances from 1.148(15) to 1.167(14) Å, respectively (Nα is the bridging atom within the azide group). The mean planes of the two pyridyl rings within the disordered bipy-O2 molecules are inclined by approx. 65°.

Within the dimeric subunits the dicyanamide anions act as bis-μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-bridging ligands, whereas the dimeric subunits are further linked to four neighbouring subunits <ce:italic>via</ce:italic> single μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-dca bridges to generate a polymeric 2D system extended along the <ce:italic>a</ce:italic>- and <ce:italic>c</ce:italic>-axis of the orthorhombic unit cell (). Along the <ce:italic>b</ce:italic>-axis the 2D system of the Cd-dca sublattice is separated by the stacking of the bipy-O2 molecules. The distorted CdN4O2 octahedra have Cd<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>N/O bond lengths in the range from 2.2750(12) to 2.3603(11) Å. The intra-sheet Cd⋯Cd distances are 7.6443(6) and 7.2749(7) Å. The N(1)-C(1)-C(6)-N(2) torsion angle in the bipy-O2 molecule is −65.5°.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,5-dca)2] (3)

The crystal structure of 3 (perspective view is shown in   , a packing view in  and selected bond parameters are given in  ) consists of centrosymmetric dimeric subunits where each Cd(II) center is six-coordinated by two oxygen atoms of a chelating bipy-O2 molecule in cis conformation and four N atoms of different dicyanamide anions. Within the dimeric subunits the dicyanamide anions act as bis-μ1,5-bridging ligands, whereas the dimeric subunits are further linked to four neighbouring subunits via single μ1,5-dca bridges to generate a polymeric 2D system extended along the a- and c-axis of the orthorhombic unit cell (). Along the b-axis the 2D system of the Cd-dca sublattice is separated by the stacking of the bipy-O2 molecules. The distorted CdN4O2 octahedra have CdN/O bond lengths in the range from 2.2750(12) to 2.3603(11) Å. The bond parameters of the μ1,5-dca bridges are: CdNC: from 127.88(9) to 161.83(10)°, NCN: from 173.71(13) to 174.40(14)°, CNC: 119.34(11) and 121.27(11)°; CN(nitrile): from 1.1503(16) to 1.1596(16) Å, CN(amide): from 1.3012(16) to 1.3055(16) Å, respectively. The intra-sheet Cd⋯Cd distances are 7.6443(6) and 7.2749(7) Å. The N(1)-C(1)-C(6)-N(2) torsion angle in the bipy-O2 molecule is -65.5°.

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0100" view="all">Inspection of the literature data showed that polymeric 1D Cd(II)-bis-μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,1</ce:inf>-azido systems with <ce:italic>cis</ce:italic>-coordinated chelating ligands similar to complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were reported with 8-aminoquinoline [] and phenyl-2-pyridyl ketone []. Analogous polymeric 1D Cd(II)-bis-μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,3</ce:inf>-NCS systems with <ce:italic>cis</ce:italic>-chelating configuration as in <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> were also observed with tetramethylethylenediamine [] and 1-phenyl-1-(pyridine-2-yl)methanimine []. Recently, C. Näther and his coworkers reported that with monodentate pyridyl ligands, two octahedral conformations were obtained namely <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(BOP)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,3</ce:inf>-NCS)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] and <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(BP)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,3</ce:inf>-NCS)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>], where BOP = 4-benzoylpyridine and BP = 4-benzylpyridine []. In the former compound the two <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>-donor BOP are occupying the <ce:italic>trans</ce:italic>-position leading to the formation of linear chains by linked to pairs of μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,3</ce:inf>-NCS as this arrangement is the most common with many metal(II) ions. In contrast, in the second compound the <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>-donor PB ligands are located in <ce:italic>cis</ce:italic>-configuration which leads to the formation of <ce:italic>zig-zag-like</ce:italic> chains [].</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: Inspection of the literature data showed that polymeric 1D Cd(II)-bis-μ1,1-azido systems with cis-coordinated chelating ligands similar to complex 1 were reported with 8-aminoquinoline [] and phenyl-2-pyridyl ketone []. Analogous polymeric 1D Cd(II)-bis-μ1,3-NCS systems with cis-chelating configuration as in 2 were also observed with tetramethylethylenediamine [] and 1-phenyl-1-(pyridine-2-yl)methanimine []. Recently, C. Näther and his coworkers reported that with monodentate pyridyl ligands, two octahedral conformations were obtained namely catena-[Cd(BOP)2(μ1,3-NCS)2] and catena-[Cd(BP)2(μ1,3-NCS)2], where BOP=4-benzoylpyridine and BP=4-benzylpyridine []. In the former compound the two N-donor BOP are occupying the trans-position leading to the formation of linear chains by linked to pairs of μ1,3-NCS as this arrangement is the most common with many metal(II) ions. In contrast, in the second compound the N-donor PB ligands are located in cis-configuration which leads to the formation of zig-zag-like chains [].

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0105" view="all">On the other hand, the polymeric 2D sublattice of <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> (dimeric bis-μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-dca bridged subunits which are further linked to four neighbouring subunits <ce:italic>via</ce:italic> single μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-dca bridges) is very unusual for metal(II) dicyanamide complexes and to the best of our knowledge this dca-bonding mode was only reported in <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(L)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-dca)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] complex (L = bis(3,5-dimethylpyrazol-1-yl)methane) []. In this complex the 2D system was achieved through the two <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>-donor atoms of the single μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-dca bridges which are ligated in a <ce:italic>trans</ce:italic>-conformation to the central metal ion forming a brick-wall-type layer. In contrast, the corresponding two <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>-donor atoms in <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> are ligated in <ce:italic>cis</ce:italic>-conformation to the Cd(II) center. In general, the dimeric bis-μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-dca bridged subunits are linked to polymeric chains [], honeycomb like layers [] or form 3D network systems (with additional μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,3,5</ce:inf>-dca bridging mode) [].</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: On the other hand, the polymeric 2D sublattice of 3 (dimeric bis-μ1,5-dca bridged subunits which are further linked to four neighbouring subunits via single μ1,5-dca bridges) is very unusual for metal(II) dicyanamide complexes and to the best of our knowledge this dca-bonding mode was only reported in catena-[Cd(L)(μ1,5-dca)2] complex (L=bis(3,5-dimethylpyrazol-1-yl)methane) []. In this complex the 2D system was achieved through the two N-donor atoms of the single μ1,5-dca bridges which are ligated in a trans-conformation to the central metal ion forming a brick-wall-type layer. In contrast, the corresponding two N-donor atoms in 3 are ligated in cis-conformation to the Cd(II) center. In general, the dimeric bis-μ1,5-dca bridged subunits are linked to polymeric chains [], honeycomb like layers [] or form 3D network systems (with additional μ1,3,5-dca bridging mode) [].

<ce:section-title id="sectitle0100">Thermoanalytical investigations</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0110" view="all">The thermogravimetric heating curves for compounds <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> and <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> are given in 
<ce:float-anchor refid="fig5"></ce:float-anchor>. Compound <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> shows one step of weight loss of −47.53% from 230 to 410 °C, which is accompanied with a sharp exothermic DSC signal at 299.8 °C. This step of weight loss is a little bit larger than expected for the release of the bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide ligand (Calcd.: −45.16%). Compound <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> shows a similar behavior of weight loss of −29.27% from 250 to 330 °C accompanied with a sharp exothermic DSC signal at 280.2 °C followed by a second step of weight loss of −13.86% from 330 to 615 °C. The total weight loss of −43.13% is in good agreement with the release of the bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide ligand (Calcd.: −43.49%).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Thermoanalytical investigations

The thermogravimetric heating curves for compounds 2 and 3 are given in  . Compound 2 shows one step of weight loss of -47.53% from 230 to 410°C, which is accompanied with a sharp exothermic DSC signal at 299.8°C. This step of weight loss is a little bit larger than expected for the release of the bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide ligand (Calcd.: -45.16%). Compound 3 shows a similar behavior of weight loss of -29.27% from 250 to 330°C accompanied with a sharp exothermic DSC signal at 280.2°C followed by a second step of weight loss of -13.86% from 330 to 615°C. The total weight loss of -43.13% is in good agreement with the release of the bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide ligand (Calcd.: -43.49%).

<ce:section-title id="sectitle0105">Luminescence properties of the complexes</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0115" view="all">The luminescence of the complexes <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>3</ce:bold> and the 2,2′-bipyridine-N,N′-dioxide ligand were examined in the solid state at room temperature. Upon excitation of the bipy-O2 molecule at 395 nm, it shows emission spectrum with a weak maximum at 633 nm. The excitation of Cd(II) complexes at 366 for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and at 355 for complexes <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> and <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> revealed a single maximum at 575, 599 and 572 nm, respectively (
<ce:float-anchor refid="fig6"></ce:float-anchor>). The observed enhancement of the fluorescence of complexes <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>3</ce:bold> compared to the bipy-O2 molecule may be attributed to the increase of conformational rigidity of the non-bonding electron-pairs of the bipy-O2 ligand upon coordination with Cd(II) ion, (n → π*), and hence improving the overlap of the Cd<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>O bond [].</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Luminescence properties of the complexes

The luminescence of the complexes 1-3 and the 2,2'-bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide ligand were examined in the solid state at room temperature. Upon excitation of the bipy-O2 molecule at 395nm, it shows emission spectrum with a weak maximum at 633nm. The excitation of Cd(II) complexes at 366 for 1 and at 355 for complexes 2 and 3 revealed a single maximum at 575, 599 and 572nm, respectively ( ). The observed enhancement of the fluorescence of complexes 1-3 compared to the bipy-O2 molecule may be attributed to the increase of conformational rigidity of the non-bonding electron-pairs of the bipy-O2 ligand upon coordination with Cd(II) ion, (n → π*), and hence improving the overlap of the CdO bond [].

elements.content:
<ce:section-title id="sectitle0110">Conclusions</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0120" view="all">Three cadmium(II) coordination polymesrs (CP): <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,1</ce:inf>-N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>), <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,3</ce:inf>-NCS)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>) and <ce:italic>catena</ce:italic>-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-dca)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>) doubly bridged through μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,1</ce:inf>-N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>, μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,3</ce:inf>-NCS and μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-dca, respectively were synthesized and structurally characterized. The azido and thiocyanto complexes form 1 D linear chains, whereas the corresponding dicyanamido complex generates a 2D structure. Four <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>-donors of azido anions or two <ce:italic>N</ce:italic>
<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph> and two <ce:italic>S</ce:italic>-donor atoms from the thiocyanat are acting as bis-μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,1</ce:inf>-N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> or bis-μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,3</ce:inf>-NCS bridging ligands leading to the generation of 1 D polymeric chains in <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and 2, respectively. Within the dimeric subunits of complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold>, the dicyanamide anions act as bis-μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-bridging ligands which are further linked to four neighbouring subunits <ce:italic>via</ce:italic> single-μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,5</ce:inf>-dca bridges to generate a polymeric 2D system. In all cases the pseudohalide ligands are located in <ce:italic>cis</ce:italic>-conformation to the Cd(II) center. In the latter complex, the <ce:italic>cis</ce:italic>-conformation around the central Cd(II) ion seems to be unusual in studied diacyanamido-metal(II) complexes. With mono- and bidentate coligands coordinated to the central metal ions and bridging through pseudohalides, the prediction of <ce:italic>cis</ce:italic>/<ce:italic>trans</ce:italic> bonding geometry is still unclear and more systems should be investigated. The title complexes <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>3</ce:bold> exhibit emission spectra with similar luminescence enhancement as observed for Cd(II) and Zn(II) pseudohalide complexes with other pyridine-<ce:italic>N</ce:italic>-oxide co-ligands.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Conclusions

Three cadmium(II) coordination polymesrs (CP): catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,1-N3)2] (1), catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,3-NCS)2] (2) and catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,5-dca)2] (3) doubly bridged through μ1,1-N3, μ1,3-NCS and μ1,5-dca, respectively were synthesized and structurally characterized. The azido and thiocyanto complexes form 1 D linear chains, whereas the corresponding dicyanamido complex generates a 2D structure. Four N-donors of azido anions or two N  and two S-donor atoms from the thiocyanat are acting as bis-μ1,1-N3 or bis-μ1,3-NCS bridging ligands leading to the generation of 1 D polymeric chains in 1 and 2, respectively. Within the dimeric subunits of complex 3, the dicyanamide anions act as bis-μ1,5-bridging ligands which are further linked to four neighbouring subunits via single-μ1,5-dca bridges to generate a polymeric 2D system. In all cases the pseudohalide ligands are located in cis-conformation to the Cd(II) center. In the latter complex, the cis-conformation around the central Cd(II) ion seems to be unusual in studied diacyanamido-metal(II) complexes. With mono- and bidentate coligands coordinated to the central metal ions and bridging through pseudohalides, the prediction of cis/trans bonding geometry is still unclear and more systems should be investigated. The title complexes 1-3 exhibit emission spectra with similar luminescence enhancement as observed for Cd(II) and Zn(II) pseudohalide complexes with other pyridine-N-oxide co-ligands.

<ce:section-title id="sectitle0045">Synthesis of the complexes</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0050" view="all">
<ce:bold>Caution</ce:bold>! Salts of azide and their metal complexes are potentially explosive and should be handled with great care and in small quantities.</ce:para><ce:section-title id="sectitle0050">Synthesis of catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ<ce:inf loc="post">1,3</ce:inf>-N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0055" view="all">To mixture containing Cd(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.154 g, 0.50 mmol) and bipyrdine-N,N'-dioxide (0.095 g, 0.50 mmol) dissolved in MeOH (20 mL), an aqueous solution of NaN<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (0.065 g, 1.00 mmol in 5 mL H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O) was added. The resulting solution was heated for 5 min on a steam-bath, filtered through celite and then allowed to crystallize at room temperature. In the following day, the white long needles which separated were collected by filtration, washed with propan-2-ol and Et<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O, and dried in the air (yield: 0.130 g, 68%). Characterization: <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Synthesis of the complexes

 Caution! Salts of azide and their metal complexes are potentially explosive and should be handled with great care and in small quantities.

Synthesis of catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,3-N3)2] (1)

To mixture containing Cd(NO3)2⋅4H2O (0.154g, 0.50mmol) and bipyrdine-N,N'-dioxide (0.095g, 0.50mmol) dissolved in MeOH (20mL), an aqueous solution of NaN3 (0.065g, 1.00mmol in 5mLH2O) was added. The resulting solution was heated for 5min on a steam-bath, filtered through celite and then allowed to crystallize at room temperature. In the following day, the white long needles which separated were collected by filtration, washed with propan-2-ol and Et2O, and dried in the air (yield: 0.130g, 68%). Characterization: Anal. Calc. for C10H8CdN8O2 (384.63g/mol): C, 31.23; H, 2.10; N, 29.13. Found: C, 31.04; H, 2.07; N, 29.06%. Selected IR bands (ATR-IR, cm-1): 3082 (w), 2050 (s), 2029 (s), 1488 (m), 1425 (m), 1336 (m), 1285 (m), 1200 (s), 846 (m), 829 (s), 765 (vs).

Synthesis of catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,3-NCS)2] (2)

The complex was isolated as white tiny crystals using a similar procedure to that described for 1 except NH4NCS was used instead of NaN3 (yield: 52%). Characterization: Anal. Calc. for C12H8CdN4O2S2 (416.75g/mol): C, 34.52; H, 1.93; N, 13.44. Found: C, 34.23; H, 2.08; N, 13.33%. Selected IR bands (ATR-IR, cm-1): 3057 (w), 2100 (s), 1477 (m), 1439 (m), 1423 (m), 1246 (s), 1216 (s), 1252 (w), 1033 (w), 942 (w), 855 (m), 835 (m), 764 (vs), 719 (s).

Synthesis of catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,5-dca)2] (3)

The complex was isolated as white tiny crystals using a procedure similar to that described for 1 except Nadca was used instead of NaN3 (yield: 92%). Characterization: Anal. Calc. for C14H8CdN10O2 (432.68g/mol): C, 38.86; H, 1.86; N, 25.90. Found: C, 38.80; H, 1.99; N, 25.71%. Selected IR bands (ATR-IR, cm-1): 3058 (w); 2301 (s), 2262 (m), 2168 (s), 2162 (vs), 2145 (vs), 1472 (m), 1428 (m), 1357 (s), 1292 (w), 1233 (s), 1210 (s), 1160 (w), 1120 (m), 1032 (w), 931 (w), 848 (m), 832 (s), 791 (m), 779 (vs).

cln_elements.clean_text:
Description of the crystal structures

Catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,1-N3)2] (1)

A perspective view of a section of the polymeric chain of 1 is given in  , a packing view in  and selected bond parameters are summarized in  . Each of the two crystallographic independent Cd(II) metal centers are six-coordinated by four N-donors of azido anions which act as bis-μ1,1-bridging ligands to generate polymeric chains of polyhedra along the c-axis of the triclinic unit cell, whereas the remaining two sites are occupied by two cis-coordinated oxygen donor atoms of the chelating bipy-O2 molecule. The atoms of complex 1 show a two-fold disorder with approx. 2:1 occupancy ratio of their two split orientations. Within the distorted CdN4O2 octahedra the CdN bond distances are in the range from 2.263(11) to 2.381(11) Å, and the CdO bond distances vary from 2.212(4) to 2.439(4) Å, respectively. The bis-μ1,1-azide bridges have the following bond parameters: CdNCd from 100.2(4) to 107.8(4)°, NCdN from 72.2(4) to 85.2(4)°, CdNN from 119.2(8) to 128.1(10)°, NNN from 177.5(14) to 178.8(14)°. The intra-chain Cd⋯Cd distances are 3.670, 3.588 and 3.715Å, whereas the shortest inter-chain metal-metal separation is 8.827Å. The azide groups are asymmetric with longer Nα-Nβ bond distances from 1.198(14) to 1.228(14) Å, and shorter Nβ-Nγ bond distances from 1.148(15) to 1.167(14) Å, respectively (Nα is the bridging atom within the azide group). The mean planes of the two pyridyl rings within the disordered bipy-O2 molecules are inclined by approx. 65°.

Catena-[Cd(bipy-O2)(μ1,5-dca)2] (3)

The crystal structure of 3 (perspective view is shown in   , a packing view in  and selected bond parameters are given in  ) consists of centrosymmetric dimeric subunits where each Cd(II) center is six-coordinated by two oxygen atoms of a chelating bipy-O2 molecule in cis conformation and four N atoms of different dicyanamide anions. Within the dimeric subunits the dicyanamide anions act as bis-μ1,5-bridging ligands, whereas the dimeric subunits are further linked to four neighbouring subunits via single μ1,5-dca bridges to generate a polymeric 2D system extended along the a- and c-axis of the orthorhombic unit cell (). Along the b-axis the 2D system of the Cd-dca sublattice is separated by the stacking of the bipy-O2 molecules. The distorted CdN4O2 octahedra have CdN/O bond lengths in the range from 2.2750(12) to 2.3603(11) Å. The bond parameters of the μ1,5-dca bridges are: CdNC: from 127.88(9) to 161.83(10)°, NCN: from 173.71(13) to 174.40(14)°, CNC: 119.34(11) and 121.27(11)°; CN(nitrile): from 1.1503(16) to 1.1596(16) Å, CN(amide): from 1.3012(16) to 1.3055(16) Å, respectively. The intra-sheet Cd⋯Cd distances are 7.6443(6) and 7.2749(7) Å. The N(1)-C(1)-C(6)-N(2) torsion angle in the bipy-O2 molecule is -65.5°.

Thermoanalytical investigations

The thermogravimetric heating curves for compounds 2 and 3 are given in  . Compound 2 shows one step of weight loss of -47.53% from 230 to 410°C, which is accompanied with a sharp exothermic DSC signal at 299.8°C. This step of weight loss is a little bit larger than expected for the release of the bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide ligand (Calcd.: -45.16%). Compound 3 shows a similar behavior of weight loss of -29.27% from 250 to 330°C accompanied with a sharp exothermic DSC signal at 280.2°C followed by a second step of weight loss of -13.86% from 330 to 615°C. The total weight loss of -43.13% is in good agreement with the release of the bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide ligand (Calcd.: -43.49%).

Luminescence properties of the complexes

The luminescence of the complexes 1-3 and the 2,2'-bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide ligand were examined in the solid state at room temperature. Upon excitation of the bipy-O2 molecule at 395nm, it shows emission spectrum with a weak maximum at 633nm. The excitation of Cd(II) complexes at 366 for 1 and at 355 for complexes 2 and 3 revealed a single maximum at 575, 599 and 572nm, respectively ( ). The observed enhancement of the fluorescence of complexes 1-3 compared to the bipy-O2 molecule may be attributed to the increase of conformational rigidity of the non-bonding electron-pairs of the bipy-O2 ligand upon coordination with Cd(II) ion, (n → π*), and hence improving the overlap of the CdO bond [].
